sense.name: hurling or propelling an object
sense.examples: The outfielder's throw to second got the runner out. His throws are not quite accurate enough for him to be a quarterback. The students celebrated their graduation by a throw of their caps into the air.

sense.name: a unit cost of something
sense.examples: The street artists paints portraits for $25 a throw. These replacement cartridges at $50 a throw are really expensive.

sense.name: range of motion of a moving machinery part
sense.examples: What is the throw of this slide valve? The throw of this cam doesn't seem quite right.

sense.name: a home furnishing that is a fabric cover
sense.examples: Sally admired the hand-made Afghan throw on her canopied bed. These bright cotton throws on the front entryway or kitchen floor add a touch of summer to your home. Mary curled up on the couch with a cup of tea, drawing a cashmere throw about her shoulders.

sense.name: tossing of die or dice
sense.examples: John's next throw in Monopoly was a pair of sixes. On one throw of the dice the gambler won two thousand dollars. For a fair die, what is the probability of a throw of 'three'?

sense.name: physical displacement of two sides of a geological fault
sense.examples: The big earthquake offset the throw of the fault by another ten feet. The geology students were measuring the throw of the fault along the valley floor.
